concepts.name: Lifecycle Assessment Characteristics
concepts.description: Core LCA framework characteristics: the functional unit (quantitative reference for comparison, e.g., kg milk or kg protein), system boundary (e.g. 'cradle-to-gate', 'cradle-to-farm gate'), methodology standards (ISO 14040/14044, PAS 2050), emission calculation models, background databases used (e.g., Ecoinvent, IPCC), LCA software tools, and any stated study limitations

concepts.name: Results
concepts.description: Environmental impact assessment results beyond climate change: acidification potential (kg SO2-eq or mol H+-eq per functional unit, from NH3, NOx, SO2 emissions), eutrophication potential (kg PO4-eq or kg N-eq, from nutrient runoff/leaching), freshwater depletion (m³ or liters of water consumed), carbon footprint/global warming potential (kg CO2e), cumulative energy demand/CED (MJ primary energy), land use or land occupation (m²·year), fossil resource depletion (kg oil-eq), metal depletion (kg Fe-eq), allocation method used for this assessment, and methodological notes (characterization method like CML, ReCiPe, IMPACT 2002+).
